sentences.english: "Look, Nanny, perfume, " Eleanor holds up a bottle of cologne.
sentences.chinese: “太婆，看，香水，”埃莉諾舉起了一瓶香水。

sentences.english: An old women found out a empty bottle which had ever been filled the best wine .
sentences.chinese: 一個老太婆找到一個不久前曾裝過最好陳酒的空酒瓶。

sentences.english: The old lady at the desk leered at her knowingly.
sentences.chinese: 辦公桌旁的老太婆會心地斜睨了她一眼。

sentences.english: The carline is fond of prying into others's things.
sentences.chinese: 這位老太婆愛打聽別人家的事。

sentences.english: "We just want to help, Mom, " Eleanor retorts .
sentences.chinese: “我們只是想幫太婆，媽媽，”埃莉諾反駁說。

sentences.english: “I gave it to a poor old woman, ” he answered.
sentences.chinese: “我給了一個可憐的老太婆，”他回答說。

sentences.english: An old woman came along the road leaning on her staff.
sentences.chinese: 有一個老太婆拄着手杖沿路走過來。

sentences.english: The old woman's eyes were bedimmed with sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 這老太婆的雙眼蒙上了一層悲愁。

sentences.english: The old lady climbed up the stairs with difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 這位老太婆艱難地爬上樓梯。

sentences.english: She recommended her baby to the care of an old woman.
sentences.chinese: 她把嬰兒託付給一位老太婆照管。

sentences.english: Ceng Yin and Tan Xiang began to arrange money woman 's birthday.
sentences.chinese: 曾音和譚香就開始佈置錢太婆的生日了。

sentences.english: The old woman rambled on about her misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 這位老太婆談起她的不幸遭遇東拉西扯地說個沒完。

sentences.english: He had a new woman tub.
sentences.chinese: 老太婆果然有了一隻新木盆。

sentences.english: "You weren't looking for a little old lady, " said Gussie .
sentences.chinese: “你根本就沒在找一個小老太婆，”格西說。
又過三月餘，錢太婆不行了。

sentences.english: The old woman stood facing him in silence and looking inquiringly at him.
sentences.chinese: 老太婆默默地站在他面前，疑問地注視着他。

definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
grandfather's sister/sister of a woman's father-in-law
polite term for old woman or man
(informal) grandma (paternal grandmother)/(respectful) mistress of the house/CL:位[wei4]/(coll.) boobies/breasts
(respectful for) one's grandfather/sb's father/older people/the head of the house (used by servants)/a district magistrate
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
great uncle/grandfather's younger brother/husband's father's younger brother
